cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles ENE of St. Thomas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest toward the Turks and Caicos and Bahamas, then curving toward the Florida Peninsula and the Southeast U.S. coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch in effect Cuba Matanzas-Guantánamo and Central Bahamas (no U.S. coast yet)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings for northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, N. Dominican Republic, N. Haiti, Turks & Caicos, SE Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeastern U.S. coastline from South Florida northward to the Georgia/South Carolina border likely to feel impacts late weekend into early next week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) possible by late Sunday night or early Monday; risk of stronger gusts if the track shifts closer to the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 3–6 ft possible along the Georgia coast owing to persistent onshore flow and large wave setup as Irma passes to the south/west.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain with local higher amounts causing flash-flooding Monday–Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and possible coastal erosion; isolated tornadoes in rainbands.
